docs.snippet: Google’s Android team of developers has, among other things, updated the photo-sharing capabilities of T-Mobile’s G1 phone.....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Android development team at Google will release an update this week that gives the T-Mobile G1 phone a bunch of new functions and improves some old ones. The upgrade, called 1.5, adds a certain-to-be-controversial virtual keyboard, like the ones the iPhone and Blackberry Storm have. The keyboard works vertically or in landscape mode in all applications -- a feature the iPhone won't have until its new system release, which is expected this summer.

headline.main: A Google Team Effort Takes A Phone to the Next Level

The approach is closer to that of the European Union, where regulators last week fined Intel $1.45 billion for abusing its power in the chip market.

docs.snippet: Google unveiled a grab bag of enhancements to its Web search engine and experimental features last week that aim to keep the company ahead of rivals.     Google's engineers showcased an experimental feature called Google Squared that extracts info...
docs.lead_paragraph: Google unveiled a grab bag of enhancements to its Web search engine and experimental features last week that aim to keep the company ahead of rivals. Google's engineers showcased an experimental feature called Google Squared that extracts information from the Web and displays it in a table. For instance, if you type ''science fiction television shows,'' it may return a table of shows with several columns of information about them, like their release dates, lead actors, directors and the networks that broadcast them. Results can be saved and shared in a spreadsheet.

headline.main: A String of Tricks, Thanks to Google

[B3.]

docs.snippet: Chrome has been made even faster....
docs.lead_paragraph: I wrote a week ago that Google was downplaying the best feature of its Chrome browser: speed. Tested against Firefox and Internet Explorer 8 on a freshly set-up laptop, Chrome's blazing-fast renderings of Web pages needed no fussy benchmark tests. Google's browser made the others seem hesitant to show me the Internet.

docs.snippet: New ways to manipulate your search results are now available from Google....
docs.lead_paragraph: Google's new Search Options feature, unveiled last week, include a couple of inventive ways to see your results. After you click the "Show options" link on the search results page, a link in the left column lets you see your hits as a Wonder Wheel - a graphic that shows the search term encircled by a set of links leading to related keywords and phrases. Image and standard Web page results are also listed along the right side of the page. The left column on the Options page has a Timeline view as well, which tries to sort results based on chronological order.

headline.main: Q & A: Friday Tip of the Week - New Google Search Options

docs.abstract: New ways to manipulate your search results are now available from Google.

docs.snippet: From hyperlocalism to Googlezon, the next generation of journalists forecasts environmental communication in 2014....
docs.lead_paragraph: On a recent visit to Ohio University, I talked with journalism and science students about communication and the environment. We discussed the merits and limits of blogging, which can be a great two-way pipeline for ideas and observations, but mostly serves a pre-sorted audience. We did the same for print and television coverage, which can expose general audiences to issues and ideas they might never otherwise consider, but sometimes convey more definitiveness than exists. And of course we talked about the challenges confronting media in a world of free information sources and dispersing, declining advertising income. I gave my sense of where we're headed (more on that here), then turned the tables on students of Professor Bernhard Debatin and asked the following:What is your vision of how the public will track environmental issues and developments in five years?

headline.main: Environmental Communication in 2015

docs.abstract: From hyperlocalism to Googlezon, the next generation of journalists forecasts environmental communication in 2014.

docs.snippet: Google showcases Wave, an application that runs in a Web browser to create a shared online desktop....
docs.lead_paragraph: Jens and Lars Rasmussen, the two brothers who created what would become Google Maps, have spent the last couple of years holed up in Google's offices in Sydney, Australia, dreaming up a new tool for communicating over the Web. On Thursday, at a Google conference for developers in San Francisco, they showcased the fruits of their work: Google Wave.

headline.main: Google Showcases New Communication and Collaboration Tool

docs.abstract: Google showcases Wave, an application that runs in a Web browser to create a shared online desktop.

docs.snippet: MADOFF TRUSTEE'S PLAN  Irving H. Picard, the trustee appointed to represent the interests of Bernard L. Madoff's victims, describes his claims-paying process. His system, which so far has been criticized by victims like Helen Davis Chaitman, above...
docs.lead_paragraph: MADOFF TRUSTEE'S PLAN Irving H. Picard, the trustee appointed to represent the interests of Bernard L. Madoff's victims, describes his claims-paying process. His system, which so far has been criticized by victims like Helen Davis Chaitman, above, is finally in shape. NEW NAME IN SEARCH Microsoft introduced Bing, its new search service and answer to Google. Executives hope the name, snappier than its predecessor, Live Search, could become a verb like Google. [B1.]
